citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of a new facultively methylotrophic bacterium: description of Methylorhabdus multivorans, gen. nov., sp. nov.,

p.s: Micropruina (Mi.cro.prui'na. Gr. adj. micros small, fine; M. L. fem. n. pruina hoarfrost; M. L. fem. n. Micropruina fine hoarfrost)
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile, cocci (diameter 0.5-2.2 Î¼m), and usually occur in pairs, packets or clusters.
Colonies and liquid cultures are white in colour.
The cell wall peptidoglycan contains meso-DAP.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C14:0, anteiso-C15:0, C16:0 and iso-C16:0.
The cells contain menaquinone-9(H4) as the major quinone.
The phylogenetic position is in the high G+C Gram-positive bacteria; the genera Microlunatus and Friedmanniella are closely related to this genus.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA is 70.5 mol%.
The type species is Micropruina glycogenica.
